text: Angelo Di Livio (born 26 July 1966) is a former Italian football player. He has played for Italy national team. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== :Source: Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League League League Coppa Italia Coppa Italia Europe Europe Total Total Club Season Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Roma 1984–85 Serie A 0 0 Reggiana 1985–86 Serie C1 13 0 Nocerina 1986–87 Serie C1 31 1 Perugia 1987–88 Serie C2 34 3 Perugia 1988–89 Serie C1 33 1 Perugia 1989–90 Serie C1 5 0 Padova 1989–90 Serie B 29 2 Padova 1990–91 Serie B 36 3 Padova 1991–92 Serie B 36 3 Padova 1992–93 Serie B 36 3 Juventus 1993–94 Serie A 33 0 Juventus 1994–95 Serie A 27 1 Juventus 1995–96 Serie A 32 2 Juventus 1996–97 Serie A 32 1 Juventus 1997–98 Serie A 30 0 Juventus 1998–99 Serie A 33 1 Fiorentina 1999–00 Serie A 30 1 Fiorentina 2000–01 Serie A 33 1 Fiorentina 2001–02 Serie A 32 1 Fiorentina 2002–03 Serie C2 21 0 Fiorentina 2003–04 Serie B 43 4 Fiorentina 2004–05 Serie A 12 0 Total Total Total 609 29 53 2 67 1 740 32 ===International=== :Source: Italy national team Year Apps Goals 1995 2 0 1996 7 0 1997 10 0 1998 6 0 1999 2 0 2000 5 0 2001 5 0 2002 3 0 Total 40 0 ==Honours== Juventus *Serie A: 1994–95, 1996–97, 1997–98 *Coppa Italia: 1994–95 *Supercoppa Italiana: 1995, 1997 *UEFA Champions League: 1995–96 *UEFA Super Cup: 1996 *Intercontinental Cup: 1996 Fiorentina *Coppa Italia: 2000–01 *Serie C2: 2002–03 Perugia *Serie C2: 1987–88 Italy *UEFA European Championship runner-up: 2000 Individual * ACF Fiorentina Hall of Fame: 2023 Orders * 5th Class / Knight: Cavaliere Ordine al Merito della Repubblica Italiana: 2000 ==References== Category:1966 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Rome Category:Italy at UEFA Euro 1996 Category:Italy at the 1998 FIFA World Cup Category:Italy at UEFA Euro 2000 Category:Italy at the 2002 FIFA World Cup
